basics.name: Rodrigo Nemmen
basics.label: Research Lead & Faculty
basics.summary: As an astrophysicist with 10+ years studying black holes and complex astronomical phenomena, I've developed expertise in computational models and scientific data exploration.

work.name: University of Sao Paulo
highlights: Led teams of 5 to 10 data and computational scientists in ML, predictive modeling and simulation projects. I oversee our research goals, core strategies and data science roadmap.
work.highlights: Conceptualized and spearheaded the training of a TensorFlow deep learning model on an image dataset representing astrophysical gas dynamics, resulting in forecasting 10,000x faster than traditional methods.

Devised and led the deployment strategy of a deep learning model for astronomical spectra, accelerating predictions from input parameters by 1000x and enabling Bayesian inference with Markov chain Monte Carlo.

work.name: Stanford University
work.summary: Carried out research in high-energy astrophysics and machine learning, working with Professor Roger Blandford

work.name: NASA Goddard Space Flight Center
highlights: Lead developer for BCESâ€”a Python regression package now used by hundreds of astronomers worldwide.

Conducted feature engineering and regression analysis on satellite data, uncovering causal relationships in black hole power and radiation, which led to a new empirical law and a publication in Science.
Employed techniques like partial correlation, multivariate regression, and bootstrapping on data from 35 galaxies, revealing significant links between galaxy properties and black hole feedback.
